metadata.title: CVE-2016-7124 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
ext/standard/var_unserializer.c in PHP before 5.6.25 and 7.x before 7.0.10mishandles certain invalid objects, which allows remote attackers to causea denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via craftedserialized data that leads to a (1) __destruct call or (2) magic methodcall.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
